articles.title: AlphaFold: Why DeepMind’s protein-folding AI is transformational
articles.description: Understanding proteins and their complex 3D shapes is key to understanding life, and especially for developing drugs
articles.content:

articles.title: Could next-generation vaccines finally end the covid-19 pandemic?
articles.description: Nasal vaccines that prevent people from catching the coronavirus may help stem transmission, while universal vaccines could target proteins found in every SARS-CoV-2 variant

articles.title: Chronic fatigue syndrome may be caused by mini blood clots
articles.description: Microclots that block blood and oxygen flow are a possible explanation for long covid symptoms like exhaustion and brain fog. Now it seems they may be to blame for chronic fatigue syndrome too
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
Persistent exhaustion is characteristic of chronic fatigue syndrome
LightField Studios Inc./Alamy
People with chronic fatigue syndrome may have tiny clots in their blood. These micro… [+430 chars]

articles.title: Voice jammer stops anyone from recording you speak
articles.description: An artificial intelligence voice jammer can unobtrusively block microphones recording a single voice in an area, avoiding causing wider disruption that might tip people off
articles.content:

articles.title: Greenhouse gas emissions are warming up nights faster than days
articles.description: Since 1951, the gap between night and day temperatures has closed by 0.41°C, and simulations show that the bulk of this warming is due to greenhouse gas emissions
articles.content:

articles.title: Pobblebonk frogs have a weird trick for surviving very acidic pools
articles.description: Highly acidic water usually breaks down a tadpole’s gill lining, but an Australian frog has evolved to suck in more protective calcium from the extreme ecosystem where it lives
articles.content:
By Jake Buehler
A scarlet-sided pobblebonk frog in south-east Queensland, Australia

articles.title: Monkeypox linked to penis swelling and rectal pain in ongoing outbreak
articles.description: Penis swelling and rectal pain don't normally occur with monkeypox, but a study of around 200 men in London suggests the symptoms may be common in the latest outbreak
